column1: Well this has certainly turned out to be a crappy vacation (28/03-04/04). Flying CAK-ATL-LHR-ATL-CAK, so I'm still safe?, but at this point, may as well put me out of my misery and include the UK too. Sigh.Edited: 9:22 pm, March 11, 2020
Yes, we are rescheduling. This situation has gotten way too volatile for our comfort. Can't imagine having less than 48 hours to book new flights home.

I don't even know what to do. We are supposed to fly in to London on Friday. The problem is that we were going to take the Eurostar to Paris on Wednesday and fly home from Paris. Sure, we can change the flight without change fees, but flight prices have DOUBLED since we booked them. There are five of us going. So, to change from flying home from Paris to flying home from London we would have to pay over $2500.If we cancel our flights and reschedule for later, we are out our AirBnB money and all of the attractions we prepaid for. So, that option also leaves us out $2500.I am so dang annoyed.

How will that stop people from Europe to enter the US? What if someone from Europe fly to other countries outside Europe then to the US?Does this mean US citizens currently in Europe cannot return to US for 30 days also? Or will they be quarantined when they come back?Excluding U.K.? How will that help if U.K. doesn’t ban travel to and from Europe? We can go to U.K. and get it from other Europeans that travel to U.K. I am confused.Edited: 9:34 pm, March 11, 2020

"Does this mean US citizens currently in Europe cannot return to US for 30 days also?"They have until Friday to come back to the US. And Olivia is already on to something. Continental tourists could make their way to the UK to fly out after Friday, but they're going to pay heavily for it.
How will that stop people from Europe to enter the US? What if someone from Europe fly to other countries outside Europe then to the US?By checking Passports for all flights to the US I imagine
And now the CDC has put the UK on ALERT 2, completely skipping the WATCH 1.https:/…coronavirus-united-kingdom

We have just seen it here on the BBC in the last half hour, but wait! It is so sketchy that the BBC News Website says that the story is still breaking and is being “updated” constantly.So as of now the story is that all visitors from Europe will be banned from entering the US for the next 30 days! It also says this EXCLUDES the UK!I could be wrong, but I don’t see your Government denying entry to US Citizens when they already had flown home other Citizens from Cruise Ships Etc earlier.
Dayton, your travel date is almost the same as ours! Ours is March 28-April 5.!!I agree they might as well include U.K. so we are out of misery altogether. I am already torn and not sure what to do.
Fly into Canada and drive across the border?

As always, you have to look at the detail!The President also said “the European Union had failed to take the same precautions as the US”Now, is the President meaning the political entity of the EU, or is he being loose with his facts and assuming that the whole Continent of Europe is the “EU”! It’s not the first time he has been, let’s just say, not entirely “clued up” with geo-politics!If he is referring to the political entity that is the EU, and by deliberately excluding the UK, is he taking a swipe at the EU? Remember, he expressly encouraged Theresa May and Boris Johnson to ditch the EU during Brexit!

Olivia S, please get in touch with Airbnb to check what their current refund policy is regarding cancellations because of the virus. I believe they’ve said that any guests that have to cancel because of their country’s imposed restrictions will probably be refunded in full, including fees.
I have a feeling that Brexit was part of Trump's decision. Most think him daft, but sly is a better descriptor.
Right that’s it! Now I am panicking!!!Tom Hanks has just tested positive for it in Australia!I mean think about it? Sully!

Now it is getting confusing.He clearly has slated the EU for failing to halt movement from China.But he has included Switzerland, which is not a member of the EU, and excluded Ireland, which is a Member.I think he running it along the lines of the Schengen Zone.They have also confirmed it would not affect US Citizens returning who had been screened.Edited: 10:25 pm, March 11, 2020
I think it is defined by geographic location and not by EU membership.

The proclamation actually refers to just the Schengen area. This information is copied from the BBC website."Today President Donald J. Trump signed a Presidential Proclamation, which suspends the entry of most foreign nationals who have been in certain European countries at any point during the 14 days prior to their scheduled arrival to the United States. These countries, known as the Schengen Area, include:Austria, Belgium,Czech Republic,Denmark,Estonia,Finland,France,Germany,Greece,HungaryIceland,Italy,Latvia,Liechtenstein,Lithuania,Luxembourg,Malta,Netherlands,Norway,PolandPortugal,Slovakia,Slovenia,Spain,Sweden,Switzerland."Note that one EU member state, the Republic of Ireland, is NOT included in the travel ban. This makes sense, as the Irish Republic is in the Common Travel Area with the UK.Also three countries included in the travel ban are not EU member states, ie. Norway, Lichtenstein and Switzerland.The wording of the ban suggests that it is sufficient to have been in the countries affected to be excluded. So if someone with a French passport flies from Paris to Montreal and then tries to cross the border into the US, the are likely to be excluded. Similarly someone with a German passport could fly from Berlin to London, but then they may be denied boarding at Heathrow or Gatwick.It is not clear what would happen to a UK passport holder who did a day trip from London to Paris on Eurostar a week before travelling to the US. UK passports are not stamped when travelling to and from France. However they are scanned at the airport or railway station, so there is an electronic record of travel. If this is available to the check in staff at the UK airport, then the person concerned could still be denied boarding.Or the US could simply revoke the ESTAs and visas of all citizens of the countries concerned who are due to travel for the period of the ban. You have to provide API (advance passenger information) before travel, so they have all the details they need.Edited: 10:52 pm, March 11, 2020
I'd be inclined to take my chances on this side of the pond.
madscotsman, certainly having property(golf course) in Ireland and no property in Switzerland would not influence his thinking.
He has two courses in Scotland.

I am so dang annoyed.So long as you are annoyed at the right person(s)!!
So citizens of Schengen countries who live in the UK will be banned but not UK citizens living in Schengen countries.

>>So citizens of Schengen countries who live in the UK will be banned but not UK citizens living in Schengen countries.<<No.What Trump said and what he should've said are completely different.The ban is for anybody who has been in the Schengen zone in the last 14 days.See Homeland security statement:https://www.dhs.gov/news/2020/03/11/homeland…

Okay the news is in a tizzy but actually its “foreign nationals“ who currently cannot enter the US. It seems as though airports will conduct health screenings to let citizens and residents back in if they travel out. https:/…index.html

Sorry to hear this. You can always ask for reverse payment with credit card company, but you would need to request refund first before contacting credit card company. Good luck.
Boy, if only political statements can be made about you know who, but I'll keep my mouth shut!

It is hard to see what difference this can possibly make, now that the virus is all around the world. Apart from spreading further panic and pushing stock markets down further.Meanwhile the scale of what is surely now a massive problem within the US largely remains disguised by what will probably come to be seen as one of the most inept public responses of any western government of all time.
You do something, people complain. You don't do something, people complain. Complain complain complain.
Absurd to exclude the UK (and Ireland) from the ban.Reading the DHS statement it might be better in future to release the text BEFORE the POTUS says anything
And it would be better to take the time to read and understand what is being done before popping off unrelated political blather on an international travel advice forum.
Trump made a total hash of the proclamation leading to several hours of confusion. Doesn't he have people who can write a speech?

“ Doesn't he have people who can write a speech?”I’m sure he does but he chooses to ignore them and just opens his mouth and spews out anything. He said cargo was banned and then had to tweet that cargo was not banned. It doesn’t give you confidence that he’s managing this well.It’s a mess, the only responsible thing to do is not travel instead of trying to work round the travel bans. I’ve already cancelled 2 trips and am monitoring the situation if further trips need to be cancelled.Edited: 5:20 am, March 12, 2020

Someone from Washington State (162 cases) can freely travel across the states, but someone from the Czech Republic (94 cases) can't enter the US?

OP here. Thanks for the morning read while I finish my coffee...I think.This post was just meant as a personal rant, as like several others who have been posting here lately, my vacation plans have been disrupted. Certainly not meant to be a political discussion. However, if you want to make it one...when a government agency (Department of Homeland Security) has to re-message your speech afterwards...may have been better off to include those pesky little details in your speech to begin with.Also, ICYMI, the CDC has put the Schengen countries on the highest travel ban. https:/…coronavirus-europeAnd the rest of the world on alert 2. https:/…coronavirus-globalEdited: 7:18 am, March 12, 2020

So sorry for your first-world problems. Imagine... there is confusion and mis-steps as governments struggle to find answers in the world’s first major life threatening disease pandemic in almost a hundred years. Wow.Edited: 7:20 am, March 12, 2020
https://www.politico.com/news/2020/03/12/tru…
"Bashing" is what other people do when they criticise a politician you personally like/agree with. When you criticise a politician you don't like/agree with it's called "holding to account".

It was just a mere two days ago when Trump said this about coronavirus. "It will go away. Just stay calm. It will go away... [B]e calm. It's really working out. And a lot of good things are going to happen."
re 46 - There has already been a previous pandemic this century.

“ It was just a mere two days ago when Trump said this about coronavirus. "It will go away. Just stay calm. It will go away... [B]e calm. It's really working out. And a lot of good things are going to happen."And he did not do very much in his 11 minute teleprompter reply last night. Testing? How people will survive economically? Hospital preparedness? Deep down he still believes the fairy godmother will wave her wand.......no clue at all. He still takes his cues from conservative media
I saw a clip from an interview where he said something like "everyone who wants a test gets a test", "the tests are beautiful".

Wow, John, you sure like sniping at others. Do you have anything useful to add at all, or will you just continue in the same vein just because Trump has, again made a fool of himself?Let's just wait and see how the US copes in comparison with the UK and other European countries. I'm prepared to eat my words, but I don't think it's going to be comfortable for Americans to look back at what happened once the virus is in decline.

I only wish for you and everyone good health and well-being. Why you would see this as a competition or zero sum game in which one country or leader can only win if the other loses, is disturbing.Edited: 8:23 am, March 12, 2020

I would hope that people wish good health for each other."Why you would see this as a competition or zero sum game in which one country or leader can only win if the other loses, is disturbing."I don't, perhaps others do although I see no evidence of that.The disturbing thing for me, and I assume others, is the incorrect, irrelevant and potentially dangerous statements made by some people, including leaders of countries.

>>you do something, people complain. You don't do something, people complain.<<More accurately, the sequence of Trump's actions was he did nothing (and said this was nothing to worry about) when other nations were taking reasonable precautions, including widespread testing. So yes, "people complained". Then he over-reacted and issued a confusing statement about a 'ban' that is effectively closing the barn door after the horse has bolted, AND the US still doesn't have widespread testing. So yes, "people complained".Edited: 9:29 am, March 12, 2020

John S.Once again I will reiterate, you were the one that jumped to the defence of the President, following seemingly derogatory comments from mostly your own Countrymen.Again I repeat, this has nothing to do with us on this side of the Pond.It’s just been announced in the last hour that the Scottish First Minister, Nicola Sturgeon, has “advised” that from Monday large scale gatherings of 500 or more be cancelled or curtailed!Whether she can put that over to this afternoons COBRA Meeting with Prime Minister Johnson, and get the UK Government to agree is another matter!The thinking in our country is that if you pull the “trigger” to early, and this thing really gets to crises point, the Public will ignore any future lock downs!A bit like the boy who cried wolf!
Errr this is a travel forum. Get a grip everyone and stop ranting. Get back to the travel aspect of the forum please.
I suspect that most of these post are going to be deleted by the admins by tomorrow. If my recent criticism of Brexit Johnson is anything to go by.
It's very rare that a mod would delete anything.
We do not get tested here in US, even if 1) show most of the symptoms and 2) request one. It would be bad...
My trip to London isn't until late November. Hopefully things will have calmed down by then.

The title of this post is not correct. It is NOT all travel that is suspended. It is all travel by Europeans, the ban does not apply to US citizens or their dependants. Which suggests that the ban has little to do with stopping the spread of the virus and more a political stunt.
"It is all travel by Europeans" - no, even that statement is incorrect.
Thank you..This fair made me laugh out loud..Fave comment being " Build a wall Donnie" I agree with that one

"It is all travel by Europeans" - no, even that statement is incorrect."No, I got that wrong! Apparently Trump has excluded the UK because we 'have strong borders'. He does like a strong border!Talking of things that make you laugh:'The Brazilian government has confirmed that president Jair Bolsonaro’s communications secretary Fabio Wajngarten has coronavirus just days after meeting Donald Trump at Mar-a-Lago',
Yes David. That was funny as all hell. A real laugh riot!
"Apparently Trump has excluded the UK " Not just the UK.

JohnS are you really in Iowa? You have been posting non-stop since early in the morning. Did you know there is a 7 hour time difference from Moscow, Russia not Moscow, Idaho with the TA posting hours?
@Trillion I wish this were true but so far our Airbnb Host in UK isn't budget. Deferring to Airbnb and they defer back to her. UGHEdited: 2:00 pm, March 12, 2020

if Anyone booked accommodation with a credit card, please try for a refund, or charge back first via the provider.Airbnb have told some hosts that they might have no choice but to refund and there is a lot of confusion as to what their policy actually is on any given day, depending on who you through to at their call center. Be insistent and ask to be put through to a supervisor who can escalate your case and might know more up to date info.I’m on a couple of owner forums and there is confusion on all sides as to what the policy is for cancellations and refunds with booking platforms like Airbnb and HomeWay. I know quite a few owners are refunding without penalty, as this is such an unusual occurrence. I have a booking in 2 weeks and have written to the (US) guests to assure them that I’ll refund in full if they do decide to cancel, but there will always be owners who insist on keeping to their terms, which, technically, they have the right to. What is happening lately is that the platforms are making new terms and owners and agents are being told they may not have a choice but to refund and that is causing confusion to everyone.

Yes in Iowa! In fact only 30 miles from me in Nebraska there are three corona cases. Seems a guy and his daughter went to the UK in mid February and brought it back, and infected another family member. Getting a little close to me guys...can you maybe get a handle on that over there? I’m scared.

John S .The virus doesn’t spread like ripples in a pondAs in the centre being China then moving outwards towards the USA a country at a time.There will have been USA residents who were in Asia at the time of the outbreak and the days after.They got in aeroplanes and flew over Europe and landed in the USA in various locations and took the virus with them.I find the inference from President Trump that Europe is somehow responsible for contaminating the USA both hilarious and offensive.Perhaps someone should explain to President Trump jhow the whole world is interconnected in a complex way.Edited: 3:33 pm, March 12, 2020

'Seems a guy and his daughter went to the UK in mid February and brought it back, and infected another family member.' It seems that John S has much in common with the idiot misogynist in chief as neither of them can accurately craft a falsehood. Not only is your suggestion of the infection timeline off, the CDC have yet to determine the cause of the cases in the state of Nebraska.'Getting a little close to me guys...can you maybe get a handle on that over there? I’m scared.' Written only to provoke and as such, no comment. If anything you should be frightened that the uneducated fool who bought his way into office and has no idea what to do is now trying to bluster his way through a health care crisis by taking the kill a fly with a cannon approach.

Thanks John. I have family in Nebraska near the Iowa border and am now concerned for their well being. Can't find any reference to the guy & daughter you mentioned. Please post a link so I can notify my family. They don't have internet access. Much appreciated, John.
I'm just waiting for Brad Pitt to save us.

Wondering if/how/when I can fly home:I'm in Germany, scheduled to fly home to the US, on April 12, but airlines are cancelling ever more flights and I'm not sure what to do; - try to get home asap (possibly quarantined on arrival in the US), or stay & risk getting stuck here, if eventually all flights are cancelled.
Only you can decide what you will do

ALL Travel??? I thought some travel (for US citizens and permanent residents) was still allowed. I heard American Airlines has reduced number of flights by 50% and wonder if there are still flights from Frankfurt to the US and (if yes) for how long they are expected to operate. Any help! Our spring break trip to Europe was cancelled due to the coronavirus. The airlines is offering a FULL voucher to be used at a later date. ( SO THANKFUL!). The travel company is offering an extremely small refund about 30%. We had purchased our travel insurance through the company. We would have been in Paris when the initial message was no flights from Europe was being discussed. These are very unusual circumstances. We are losing over $5000 for my husband and I and our adult daughter who paid for her own trip is losing a significant amount of money as well as our son who earned the money for the trip. I was surprised when the airline offered a full voucher! There was no offer of a future trip just pennies on the dollar. We had even paid a pre-paid tip for our tour guide. Of course that is being returned but they claim they had spend all the rest securing hotels, food, etc. Thoughts? Advice? This was to be a trip of a lifetime. Thanks in advance!
Do you have travel insurance?
There's a club of thousands in this position.

Yes but it was not cancel for any reason. Matter of fact, that wasn't even an option. My mistake was trusting the insurance they offered. I know better now. The airlines have been fabulous! They claim to have already paid vendors? ??
Thank you! Just curious is a global pandemic was a situation beyond anyone's control?

We paid a hefty deposit on a rental home to sstay with our children and grandchildren in the Cotswold's. We paid Character Cottage Holidays Limited. I am so sorry I trusted them, and wish I had rented through some other agency. During the pandemic, I own a vacation rental and have refunded everyone. They won't do the right thing and it should be illegal to keep all the funds. BEWARE of Character Cottages, they are not to be trusted. If anyone knows of a watchdog group to file a complaint with, I 'd love to know. From what I've seen online, they have done this repeatedly ti a number of guests.
